findings.title: Open SSH Port
findings.description: SSH service is running on port 22
findings.details: SSH (Secure Shell) service detected on port 22. This is normal for servers that require remote administration.
findings.recommendation: Ensure SSH is properly configured with key-based authentication and disable password authentication.

findings.title: HTTP Service Detected
findings.details: HTTP web server detected. Consider redirecting HTTP traffic to HTTPS.
findings.recommendation: Configure HTTP to HTTPS redirect for better security.

findings.title: SSL Certificate Issue
findings.details: The SSL certificate is self-signed and not trusted by browsers.
findings.recommendation: Install a valid SSL certificate from a trusted Certificate Authority.

findings.title: Outdated Web Server
findings.description: Web server version appears to be outdated
findings.details: The web server version contains known security vulnerabilities.
findings.recommendation: Update the web server to the latest stable version.

findings.title: Critical Security Flaw
findings.details: A critical security vulnerability that could allow remote code execution.
findings.recommendation: Apply security patches immediately and consider taking the service offline until fixed.
